context_0.vignette: Heinz's wife has recently fallen ill and needs an expensive medication that is not covered by her medical insurance. They do not have the money needed to purchase the expensive prescription medication, but they know that it is vital for her to have it if she is going to recover.

generation: contact the pharmaceutical company that produces the medication
explore different avenues to procure the medication or funds needed
consult with the doctor and the pharmacist about possible alternatives or generic versions of the medication which may be cheaper
seek financial assistance from non-profit organizations or charities that help with medical expenses
explore a multitude of options to ensure his wife's medication can be acquired, including:
reach out to the drug manufacturing company, as many have programs to assist individuals who cannot afford their medications
contact the pharmaceutical company that produces the medicine
seek financial help from family, friends, or charitable organizations
contact the pharmaceutical company and ask if they have a patient assistance program
explore all possible financial aid options

context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. Now Josh is sitting in his car near a busy intersection, and knows he needs to get to airport soon if he is going to catch his flight.
context_1.prompt: One thing that Josh should do is to
generation: call a taxi, Uber, or a friend to drive him to the airport while he arranges for his car to be towed or repaired
call for a taxi, Uber, or use other form of transportation service and while waiting, he may also want to alert roadside assistance for his broken car
call a taxi service, Uber, or Lyft to pick him up and take him to the airport as quickly as possible
call a taxi, Uber, or another ride service as soon as possible
call for a tow truck or roadside assistance and arrange for a taxi or another mode of transport like an Uber or Lyft to take him to the airport immediately
call for a roadside assistance or a taxi/ride-share service to get to the airport on time
call for a taxi, an Uber, or another ride-sharing service to ensure that he gets to the airport on time
call a taxi, an Uber, a friend, or a roadside assistance service to help him reach the airport in time
call a taxi or use a rideshare service like Uber or Lyft to get to the airport
call a taxi, ride-sharing service or roadside assistance to help him either fix his car quickly or get him to the airport on time

context_2.vignette: Brian is the evening manager at a bakery. Near the end of the day, he realizes that $50.75 is missing from the register and that he is responsible for accounting for the money at the end of the day. Brian knows he has to make sure the register is balanced or he might lose his job.
context_2.prompt: One thing that Brian should do is to
generation: immediately report the missing money to his supervisor or the owner of the bakery
immediately inform the bakery owner or his immediate supervisor about the missing money
carefully recount all the money in the register and double-check his accounting records to see if he made a mistake
double-check the receipts and transactions for the day
check the sales receipts and compare them with the cash in the register to see if there is a discrepancy or error
contact his supervisor to report the missing money, explaining the situation and asking for guidance on how to handle it
review the security footage if available to see if he can spot any one taking money from the register
review the receipts and transactions of the day to check for any discrepancies or mistakes
immediately report the missing money to the owner or appropriate authority, explaining the situation and any suspicions or observations he may have about why the money might be missing
check the receipts and transaction records to see if there were any mistakes made during the day

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.
context_5.prompt: One thing that Brad should do is to
generation: stay put and create a visible signal for potential rescuers
gather his group and find a sheltered place where they can stay warm and dry, while also being visible to potential rescuers
try to find a shelter or a safe place where they can stay out of the elements, and remain there
stay put
stay in one spot as moving around could make them harder to find for the rescue team
start building a shelter to protect them from the elements, preserve heat and make them more visible to rescuers
stay calm and keep everyone grouped together
stay in one place
stay in one place, as it would make it easier for rescuers to find them
find a safe and sheltered spot to set up a camp
